Positive pathway.Check-in message: Hi! Were you able to stay calm if your teen shared something sensitive or challenging? (Yes/No)
Positive pathway.Positive follow on question: Well done, that is not very easy to do! How did it go? (Great/Neutral/Bad)
Positive pathway.Great response message: We are happy to hear that it went well! This shows that you and your teen have a trusting and positive relationship. You should be proud of yourself!

List of challenges.Message: We understand! What did you find difficult about discussing challenges with your teen?

Option 1: My teen told me that something.Message: It is completely normal to experience this challenge. Praise your teen for telling you, that is not easy to do! Remember, you can use all the skills you collected in your toolbox: Take a Pause, reassure your teen that you are here for them, discuss possible solutions, and reach out to get the support you and your teen need!

Option 2: The conversation made me very.Message: When we are reminded of such situations, it is normal to feel upset or angry . It is important to find a time when you are calm, so you can think of what support you need: You may need to talk to someone.

Option 3: My teen, or me, or my family d.Message: It is completely normal to experience this challenge, this is difficult stuff to talk about. Find a calm time. You can say that we hope these things never happen, but it’s like getting insurance – it's best to think about them and be prepared.

Option 4: My teen did not discuss anythi.Message: That's okay! The important thing is that your teen knows that you are here for them. It sometimes takes time for a teen to feel comfortable sharing. Try to keep an open channel of communication with them by spending quality time together and accepting their ideas.
